title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct value of ∆G°.

∆G° = ∆H° – T∆S°

= (18 kJ mol−1) − ( 298 K)(0.078 kJ mol−1 K−1) = −5 kJ mol−1

1 point is earned for a correct justification of spontaneity.

Reaction is spontaneous because ∆G° < 0.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct choice with a correct explanation.

ΔG°=−RT ln K eq =ΔH°−TΔS°⇒ln  K eq =− ΔH° RT + ΔS° R MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaeyiLdqKaam 4raiabgclaWkabg2da9iabgkHiTiaadkfacaWGubGaaeiiaiGacYga caGGUbGaam4samaaBaaaleaacaWGLbGaamyCaaqabaGccqGH9aqpcq GHuoarcaWGibGaeyiSaaRaeyOeI0Iaamivaiabgs5aejaadofacqGH WcaScqGHshI3caqGSbGaaeOBaiaabccacaWGlbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadw gacaWGXbaabeaakiabg2da9iabgkHiTmaalaaabaGaeyiLdqKaamis aiabgclaWcqaaiaadkfacaWGubaaaiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaeyiLdq Kaam4uaiabgclaWcqaaiaadkfaaaaaaa@63C9@

Since ∆H° is positive, an increase in T will cause −∆H°/RT to become a smaller negative number, therefore Keq will increase.

OR

The reaction is endothermic (∆H = +18 kJ mol−1); an increase in temperature shifts the reaction to favor more products relative to the reactants, resulting in an increase in the value of Keq.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for a correct explanation.

Both reaction X and reaction Y have solid iodine as a reactant, but the second reactant in reaction X is chlorine gas whereas the second reactant in reaction Y is liquid bromine. Liquids have lower entropies than gases, thus in reaction Y the reactants are more ordered (and have lower entropies) than in reaction X . The products of both reaction X and reaction Y have about the same disorder, so the change in entropy from reactants to products is greater in reaction Y than in reaction X.

The products of both reaction X and reaction Y have about the same disorder, so the change in entropy from reactants to products is greater in reaction Y than in reaction X.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for ∆G° = 0.

∆G° = ∆H° – T∆S°

Keq = 1 when ∆G° = 0 ⇒ T∆S° = ∆H° ⇒

T= ΔH° ΔS° = 41 kJ​  mol −1 0.124  kJ mol −1 K −1 =330 K MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamivaiabg2 da9maalaaabaGaeyiLdqKaamisaiabgclaWcqaaiabgs5aejaadofa cqGHWcaSaaGaeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaaI0aGaaGymaiaabccacaqGRb GaaeOsaiaaygW7caqGGaGaaeyBaiaab+gacaqGSbWaaWbaaSqabeaa cqGHsislcaaIXaaaaaGcbaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaais dacaqGGaGaae4AaiaabQeacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaab+gacaqGSbWaaWba aSqabeaacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaOGaae4samaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0 IaaGymaaaaaaGccqGH9aqpcaaIZaGaaG4maiaaicdacaqGGaGaae4s aaaa@5EA4@

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for ∆H°298 of either the first or second equation.

1 point is earned for the correct sum of the ∆H°298 values.

I2(s) + Cl2(g) ⇄ 2 ICl(g) ∆H°298 = 2 x 18 kJ mol−1

I2(g) ⇄ I2(s) ∆H°298 = − 62 kJ mol−1

________________________________________________

I2(g) + Cl2(g) ⇄ 2 ICl(g) ∆H°298 = −26 kJ mol−1
